intro: Orthosiphon adenocaulis, commonly known as the slender horse-herb, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Orthosiphon adenocaulis is used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
